dialogue: You there! You're human? Oh, the stars must have guided you here. Please!
I can see you clearly now. Yes, you must be a human. My name is Fu Liang. That terrible demon Caliburn has bound me here...
Hey! It's me! Remember me right? HAHA, so you didn't get wasted after all. I guess you handled the business at Kinta well?
Of course, you came here for me right, Remnant?

dialogue.name: I've never met this woman in my life

dialogue: This key won't last for more than one use...
Yes, the stars spoke of this outcome as well. As it happens... I know for a fact that that key will not survive another use.
Quite so? And the stars didn't give you the insight to not get yourself captured?
The truth of the astral realm is not ours to beckon.
The stars aren't the ones who'll save you, Yuan Dao lackey. The only one you should be beckoning is our magnanimous savior here.
Do you want me to free you?
{gr}You had asked this to neither of them in particular{/gr}
The stars are only one of many ways to divine the natural path. I cannot tell you what choice you should make, just as I could not tell you what foot to lean upon when you walk.
Well, I'm sure I can get myself out of here given time, but I wouldn't much mind an abridged stay either.
HAHAHA, see? A proper knight in shining armor!
Even so, I beseech you, kind hero, even if the Yuan Dao and the society of the Blue are sworn enemies. Find it in your heart-
Maybe get on your knees and beg and the Remnant will consider it, GEHEHEHE!
{gr}Beatrix was taking an inordinate amount of pleasure in watching Fu Liang beg.{/gr}
Even so I believe you were sent here to help free us from this prison. The stars yet again speak to me about the boons of our co-operation.
